fs.fibu2.data.model
Class Account

java.lang.Object
  fs.fibu2.data.model.Account
Direct Known Subclasses:
AbstractAccount
public abstract class Account
extends java.lang.Object

This interface represents an fsfibu2 account, i.e. for example a bank account or a cash box. Each account requires different fields with different value formats and with different restrictions. For example a bank account transaction requires the number of the associated account statement.
Classes implementing this interface should usually have a standard no-argument constructor and should be immutable, since fsfibu2 relies on these facts an would it cause errors or unpredictable behavior, were it otherwise.

Author:
Simon Hampe

Account

public Account()
Method Detail

getFieldIDs

public abstract java.util.Vector<java.lang.String> getFieldIDs()
Returns:
A list of IDs of the fields which are required for this type of account.

getFieldNames

public abstract java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getFieldNames()
Returns:
A list of the names of the required fields, such as might be used for label texts in an entry dialog. The names are identified via their ids.

getFieldDescriptions

public abstract java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getFieldDescriptions()
Returns:
A list of descriptions for each fiels, such as might be used for a tooltip. The descriptions are identified via their ids.

getDescription

public abstract java.lang.String getDescription()
Returns:
A description of this type of account, i.e.: In which context it is used, what it stands for and what kind of information it generally requires.

getID

public abstract java.lang.String getID()
Returns:
The ID of this account. This ID will be used to identify the account of an fsfibu2 journal entry. So you should take care to make this ID uniqe. The convention is to take the name of the account, where spaces are replaced by '_' (e.g. 'bank_account', 'cash_box')

getName

public abstract java.lang.String getName()
Returns:
The name of this account (e.g. 'Bank account', 'Cash box')

verifyEntry

public abstract void verifyEntry(Entry e)
                          throws EntryVerificationException
Checks whether an entry is correct for this type of account.

Parameters:
e - The entry to be verified
Throws:
EntryVerificationException - - if the entry is not correct
